faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds a nice professor for EECS3101? Does Jeff Edmonds explain EECS3101 well?
faq.answer: Jeff is the best professor I've had so far at York. But I wish he discussed the topics using more general terms than his own e.g. fairy god mother, little birds etc.

faq.question: Should I take Jeff Edmonds's EECS3101 class if I care about my grades and GPA? Should I attend EECS3101 lectures with Jeff Edmonds?
faq.answer: Jeff's a really interesting guy with a unique style. You might find some of his ideas hard to map (fairy god mothers aren't usually an interview answer) but the steps work everywhere. Always the steps. He can get hard to follow but he tries, and he records lectures. Participation grades are weird, final is a killer (seriously), tests are fair.

faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds a nice professor for EECS3101?
faq.answer: Jeff is one the best Professor at York.

faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds a nice professor for EECS2001?
faq.answer: Good guy, bad course. Seriously, this course has some of the most obscure concepts and proofs (e.g., reductions).

faq.question: Will I enjoy taking Jeff Edmonds's class for EECS2001 and what kind of prof are they? Is Jeff Edmonds giving good grades for EECS2001?
faq.answer: He has his own teaching style ive never seen before. His slides are very boring and dull. He makes simple things very complicated. His tests are fair but the course itself is hard and he isnt the best at teaching, but is doable. I had to work very hard for this course. He is a nice person tho and really cares about students.

faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds a nice professor for CSE2001? Should I take Jeff Edmonds's CSE2001 class if I care about my grades and GPA? Does Jeff Edmonds explain CSE2001 well?
faq.answer: Great Proff! He cares about the students, will always answer questions. He has his own way of explaining concepts which you have to understand. Doesn't regrade for tests and if he does he will regrade your whole test and may lower the grade. For the tests make sure he shows you step by step how to answer the questions (ie reductions and proofs).

faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds giving good grades for EECS3101? Is attending EECS3101 lecture from Jeff Edmonds worth it to pass the class? Does Jeff Edmonds explain EECS3101 well?
faq.answer: Follow his methodology and you should do ok. Read his lecture notes and listen to him when he does his examples in class. Ask him questions. Hes a pretty funny guy. Also go to his tutorials! He does all his examples in them and goes over them so many times. His style is unusual but just put in some work and you will pass!

faq.question: Should I attend EECS2001 lectures with Jeff Edmonds? Does Jeff Edmonds explain EECS2001 well?
faq.answer: Cares about his students and WANTS them to succeed and understand. Incredibly patient and casual. Fun classes. His slides are comprehensive so they can be a bit overwhelming. Don't hesitate to ask questions thoughhe's willing to help.

faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds a nice professor for EECS2001?
faq.answer: Jeff is a good teacher for theoretical cs. The only comment I will say is that he uses fairy god mothers and gnomes to explain concepts to people over 20 years old. I prefer more of a formal style of teaching but he did make the concepts easy to understand.

faq.question: Does Jeff Edmonds explain EECS3101 well?
faq.answer: You have to know his learning methods you can't use the methods use from Google otherwise you will get the question wrong and it's hard to apply his steps for interview questions

faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds a nice professor for CSE2001?
faq.answer: Great Professor, I have learned alot and his unique style of teaching always made the material easier to understand. The material might look scary but he makes it manageable and as long as you put in the effort you will be able to understand the material and do well in this course.

faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds a nice professor for CSE2001?
faq.answer: Really good professor. Has such a different style in teaching the materials, but it really makes sense. Makes the hard concept understandable.

faq.question: Should I attend EECS3101 lectures with Jeff Edmonds?
faq.answer: Jeff teaches material in an abstract way such that you can apply these concepts to more general problems. You will first (and may continue to) find the way he lectures confusing but eventually (hopefully) you will find yourself understanding the material once understanding his teaching style.
He is an interesting fellow, has a vibrant personality. He needs to private his facebook account.

faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds giving good grades for CSE2001? Should I attend CSE2001 lectures with Jeff Edmonds? Does Jeff Edmonds explain CSE2001 well?
faq.answer: Firstly, 2001 is a hard course. It's 100% theoretical and abstract. Just remember that when you take the course. Now, when you have course material that's super hard, it helps to have a professor who teaches well. Jeff is super patient, answers literally 2 dozen questions every class, and wants everyone to pass. He makes the course bearable.

faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds a nice professor for EECS2001?
faq.answer: THE BEST PROF AT YORK, HANDS DOWN!!!!

faq.question: Will I enjoy taking Jeff Edmonds's class for EECS2001 and what kind of prof are they? Is Jeff Edmonds giving good grades for EECS2001?
faq.answer: Jeff is an amazing teacher who really cares about the students and even asks specifically if you understand the concept and want everyone to pass the course or get a good mark. He is the as best as they come.

faq.question: Should I attend EECS2001 lectures with Jeff Edmonds?
faq.answer: Well thought out lectures, amazing and extremely simple explanations and tricky exam.

faq.question: Is Jeff Edmonds a nice professor for CSE2001? Should I attend CSE2001 lectures with Jeff Edmonds?
faq.answer: I did not know that when I stepped into Jeff's class for the first time, that my life was about to be changed forever. His beautiful long hair keeps you energized, but his soft soothing voice is what keeps you coming back to class. He explains everything in great detail and will go over it until you understand it. Jeff is truly an inspiration.
